image.altText: A teen checks her Twitter notifications.

props.synopsis: Social media giants would be forced to ban children under the age of 14 from their platforms or face hefty penalties, under proposed laws in South Australia that could be replicated in other states.

title.children: 'Big, massive deterrent': Social media companies could face fines for allowing kids under 14 on their platforms

image.altText: A man walks next to a security guard and two women outside the new Royal Adelaide Hospital in Adelaide

props.synopsis: The state's premier and chief justice have paid tribute to the "highly regarded" former justice Malcolm Blue KC, who died in a farm incident in Adelaide's south on Saturday.

title.children: Legal profession mourns death of South Australia's retired justice in tractor incident

image.altText: A copule with a coffee van.

props.synopsis: Sheep and cattle station owners Bodie and Rachel Hill have become outback baristas, encouraging tourists and locals to stop for a cuppa and a chat on a claypan in an isolated corner of NSW.

title.children: Coffee van on a claypan is such an unexpected sight tourists think it's a mirage

image.altText: A tall apartment building, seen from below.

props.synopsis: ACCC chair Gina Cass-Gottlieb says commissions are driving up the cost of insurance as Four Corners exposes the hidden arrangements lining the pockets of brokers and strata management firms at the expense of apartment owners.

title.children: Insurance giant channelled undisclosed kickbacks to strata management firms

image.altText: A woman and a man sit at a table with documents and two photographs of soldiers.

props.synopsis: For years, 94-year-old Jack Hanna did not know where his father was buried. Now he's finally able to honour Private Richard Norman Hanna at his place of rest thanks to volunteers digging into history to give soldiers overdue recognition.

title.children: Thousands of soldiers have ended up in unmarked graves. One by one they are being found.

image.altText: Kamala Harris smiles and points at something above her in the distance, in front of a crowd.

props.synopsis: It has been a dream start to Kamala Harris's bid for the White House, and supporters are confident she'll beat Donald Trump in the popular vote — but the Electoral College is a different story.

title.children: Kamala Harris has a blue state dilemma that could cost her the election

image.altText: Two people wearing diving suits inside water inside a cave.

props.synopsis: Inside the Three Sisters cave is a "spectacular sight" but access and safety concerns have kept divers away. Recent upgrades to the site are expected to change that.

title.children: Divers dig a new entrance to an ancient 30-metre-deep cave just metres from a rural road

image.altText: Long green stalks of grass in plastic pots for collecting data. In the background is blue clear sky.

props.synopsis: Weeds cost Australia's crop farming industry around $3.3 billion dollars each year, but a home-grown invention that crushes herbicide-resistant weed seeds could make that a problem of the past.

title.children: Farmer invents machinery that smashes 'bejesus' out of weed seeds

image.altText: a group of four women make cheers at a table covered in colourful drawings and textas

props.synopsis: The question of how to make friends in a regional town is often answered with joining a local sports club. But in South Australia's Riverland, a group is finding other ways to connect socially.

title.children: How do you make friends when you're new in town and don't like sport?

image.altText: A man and woman hugging in front of a for sale sign at a house

props.synopsis: As the government returns to parliament to pick a new fight on housing, new figures reveal a third of first home buyers are using federal support for help to buy a home.

title.children: A third of first home buyers are leaning on government for help to put down a deposit

image.altText: A close-up of an Australian Army patch and an Australian flag patch on an ADF officer's uniform.

props.synopsis: The final report of the Royal Commission into Defence and Veteran Suicide will be handed to government today after a three year inquiry. Follow live.

title.children: Veteran suicide royal commission findings to be released

image.altText: Real estate agent puts up a sold sticker after this Mosman apartment sold at auction.

props.synopsis: Politics and timing are inextricably linked — sometimes, the Zeitgeist suits your story, other times it doesn't. Kamala Harris and Bill Shorten both know that the hard way.

title.children: Australia could be ready to say goodbye to negative gearing

image.altText: A close up of Nicki Hutley sitting in an office.

props.synopsis: It's not just older generations who think younger people are doing it tough. The list of people concerned about the impact of inflation on households includes economists, the boss of the Commonwealth Bank, Matt Comyn, and the Reserve Bank.

title.children: 'You can't blame the boomers': The generational divide behind Australia's cost of living split

image.altText: A Telstra payphone in a remote setting with trees and grass

props.synopsis: Taxpayers and telcos spend nearly $300 million a year to guarantee access to landlines and payphones, even though fewer and fewer people are using them.

title.children: The little-known 'dinosaur' policy that could be holding us back from better phone coverage

image.altText: Side profile of man with curly, dark hair and stubble. He wears a shirt and jacket and has a serious expression.

props.synopsis: South Australia's Attorney General Kyam Maher will address "gaps" in the state's law after a young mother's killer was sentenced to 11 years behind bars after he was found to be experiencing drug-induced hallucinations at the time of the offence.

title.children: SA attorney-general looks to remove self-intoxication as criminal defence

image.altText: A man sits on a stage with a headphone mic on

props.synopsis: South Australia's former Liberal leader David Speirs says a federal takeover of the state's branch should be 'seriously considered' but current leader Vincent Tarzia disagrees.

title.children: Former SA Liberal leader suggests federal takeover of state division

image.altText: Lachlan Murdoch

props.synopsis: In a polarised media world, it's never been more important to understand Lachlan Murdoch.

title.children: 'Do I need to sell my house?' The perils of writing about media mogul Lachlan Murdoch

image.altText: Donald Trump and Kamala Harris speaking into microphones in two separate images side by side.

props.synopsis: Any doubts about whether a debate could change the course of a presidential campaign have been put to rest. So both Donald Trump and Kamala Harris are awake to the high stakes of this week's face-off.

title.children: The Harris-Trump debate could reshape the race. Here's how it'll work

image.altText: A road sign reading "King Hussein Bridge Border Crossing" with an armoured vehicle behind it.

props.synopsis: The Israeli military says a truck driver opened fire at an Israeli border crossing between the occupied West Bank and Jordan on Sunday, killing three Israeli guards before security forces shot him dead.

title.children: Gunman from Jordan kills three Israelis at West Bank border crossing, Israeli army says

image.altText: A photo showing a remote community mining town home

props.synopsis: Indigenous residents of the Manaburdurma Jabiru Town Camp are devastated the area's Mirarr traditional owners plan to demolish their homes to make way for a new road, as part of plans to redevelop the town into a Kakadu tourism centre.

title.children: Amid a national housing shortage, these town camp residents can't believe their community is to be demolished

image.altText: Lauren Parker and James Turner parade with the Australian flag at the Stade de France

props.synopsis: Australia's flag-bearers James Turner and Lauren Parker have paraded around the Stade de France and Paris bids au revoir.

title.children: 'Let's keep daring': Turner and Parker fly the flag as closing ceremony caps off Paris Paralympics

image.altText: Three firefighters stand on the footpath near a red fire truck, looking towards a brick house with police tape across it.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating whether two young children and a toddler were home alone when they were critically injured in a fire at Sydenham in Melbourne's north-west.

title.children: Two children and toddler critically injured in Melbourne house fire

image.altText: Jannik Sinner holds the US Open trophy while red, white and blue confetti falls

props.synopsis: Italian world number one Jannik Sinner wins his second grand slam of the year, beating local hero Taylor Fritz in straight sets to claim the US Open.

title.children: Sinner's golden grand slam year continues with US Open final triumph over Fritz

image.altText: Tanya Plibersek stands behind Anthony Albanese at a press conference

props.synopsis: The federal government's plans to establish an environmental protection agency have hit a political impasse, calling into question whether the election commitment can be met before the end of this term of parliament.

title.children: Labor hitting political impasse seeking to establish environment cop

image.altText: A stock trader looks down at a tablet as he works on the floor of a busy stock exchange while surrounded by screens.

props.synopsis: The ASX is set to drop 1.3pc on opening following a rough session on Wall Street where disappointing jobs data undermined hopes for a soft economic landing. Follow the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX bracing for a sharp fall after US jobs data drives Wall Street down, Westpac gets new CEO

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: ASX set to fall sharply after disappointing US data

image.altText: A woman holding an umbrella walks past a fallen tree in Hanoi, Vietnam.

props.synopsis: Officials warn that despite the typhoon's waning power, significant flooding is still possible in the aftermath of the typhoon.

title.children: At least 21 killed in Vietnam as threat from Typhoon Yagi continues

image.altText: Man wearing white shirt surrounded by people pointing mobile phones at him

props.synopsis: Prosecutors issue an arrest warrant for Edmundo Gonzalez in connection with the online publication of election result tallies.

title.children: Venezuela opposition candidate seeks asylum in Spain amid election fallout

image.altText: Jim Chalmers in an interview with Insiders. The brisbane city landscape is behind him

props.synopsis: Questions on both sexual orientation and gender will feature in Australia's next census, as the federal government seeks to repair the fallout from earlier efforts to abandon questions about LGBTIQ+ identity.

title.children: Sexual orientation and gender questions to feature in next census

image.altText: A man and a woman looking over paperwork with a calculator and computer

props.synopsis: In the United States, Americans can split or average out their income with their partner to reduce the tax they pay. Could this be adopted in Australia?

title.children: 'So blatant it's bordering on laughable': Family trust accounts minimise tax, so why can't couples have a joint tax return?

image.altText: Primoz Roglic celebrates on the podium with a trophy after winning the Vuelta a Espana

props.synopsis: Slovenia's Primoz Roglič sealed a record-equalling fourth Vuelta a España title while Australian Ben O'Connor finished second.

title.children: Aussie O'Connor finishes second at La Vuelta as Roglič claims fourth crown

image.altText: Two plumes of dark grey smoke rise from a low skyline.

props.synopsis: Sudan rejects a call by UN experts for the deployment of an "independent and impartial force" to protect civilians driven from their homes by more than a year of war.

title.children: Sudan rejects UN call for 'impartial' force to protect civilians after year of war

image.altText: Children enjoying a hot beverage and toast.

props.synopsis: When students walk through the gates of Alexandra Hills State School, they can expect to attend class on a full stomach — but that isn't the case for all Australian children.

title.children: 'A full stomach makes all the difference': Schools step in as an increasing number of Australian children come to class hungry

image.altText: Pope Francis sits next to a microphone and holds papers

props.synopsis: Pope Francis was greeted by dancers adorned with feathers and brightly-painted faces, signing traditional hymns.

title.children: Thousands gather for 'once-in-a-lifetime' experience of holy mass with Pope Francis in PNG

image.altText: A snowboarder smiling at the camera with gumtrees and snowy mountains behind them.

props.synopsis: As Australia's ski season comes to an early end, resort workers say that despite low pay which barely covers rent, fuel, and two-minute noodles, they'll be back again next year.

title.children: 'Cold, wet and hungry' but Ayden says working in the snowfields is the best thing he's ever done

image.altText: A very large cockroach on a person's hand.

props.synopsis: There is a push to protect Queensland's Reedy Creek Reserve by having it recognised under a special state conservation law.

title.children: This giant burrowing cockroach could be the key to protecting 'undisturbed' coastal reserve
